intro: Oxyanthus degiorgii, commonly known as the Ethiopian yellowwood, is a small evergreen tree native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, which is dispersed by wind. It thrives in high-altitude regions and is adapted to the cool, humid conditions of its native habitat. Oxyanthus degiorgii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local communities.
